title: How to Get a Lobster Tail out of Its Shell

steps.title: Separate the tail section from the body:
steps.content: Separate the tail section from the body: [1] X Research source Center the lobster over the bowl to catch the water that will spill out. This doesn't always happen, some just do the whole process right on their plate. Hold the tail section in one hand Hold the body in the other hand Bend the two sections toward each other, across the lobster's back. You can also separate the body from the tail in a twisting motion. Be bold! Place the body in the bowl. Lobster freaks may actually twist off the little legs and suck the meat out, but it's a labor of love.

steps.title: Hold the tail section over the plate.
steps.content: Hold the tail section over the plate.

steps.title: Pull the fins off the end of the lobster tail.
steps.content: Pull the fins off the end of the lobster tail. There's tiny bits of meat in the fins, if you're inclined to work them out. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Wrap your fingers around the shell firmly, leaving the lobster meat exposed on both ends.
steps.content: Wrap your fingers around the shell firmly, leaving the lobster meat exposed on both ends.

steps.title: Poke the fork tines into the end of the tail, where you pulled the fins off.
steps.content: Poke the fork tines into the end of the tail, where you pulled the fins off. If you're comfortable using your fingers, just poke one or two fingers into the rear end and push through the tail shell. [3] X Research source

steps.title: The meat of the lobster tail will pop out the other side onto the plate!
steps.content: The meat of the lobster tail will pop out the other side onto the plate! Dig in!
